newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian stock markets have matured, says SEBI chief.
newsitem.headline: Indian stock markets have matured, says SEBI chief.

text.p: Indian stock markets have matured to a large extent, the chief of market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) said on Thursday.
SEBI chairman D.R. Mehta was replying to questions about recent volatility on the bourses at a news conference.
"Despite the volatility, the safety and integrity of the market was not affected," Mehta said.
He said trades across Indian stock exchanges on January 15 and 16, the days which saw steep volatility, amounted to a massive 80 billion rupees.
Despite such a large volume, there was hardly any default, Mehta told reporters.
